oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Fourth Tennessee Volunteer Infantry, Company E, Spanish-American War, between 1898 and 1899
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pictured: Seven military men of the 4th Tennessee Volunteer Infantry, at a campsite in Cuba, during the Spanish-American War, between 1898 and 1899. The photograph’s origin relates to Richard H. Miller, of Columbia, Tennessee, who served in the Spanish-American War as a Corporal of the 4th Tennessee Volunteer Infantry, Company E. Forms part of the Helon Daniel Miller Collection. 1 photograph.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Miller, Helon Daniel; Miller family; Miller, Richard H.
